subject: Management
title: Repeating Tasks Are Delegation Gold
description: A fast breakdown of Repeating Tasks Are Delegation Gold for builders.

hook.text: Every Monday, the manager spent two hours compiling a status update. Every. Single. Monday.

buildup.text: Recurring tasks eat predictable hours. They're also the easiest to standardize and hand off.

discovery.text: If you do something weekly, document it once and delegate it forever.

twist.text: One-off creative tasks feel harder to delegate, but repeating ones cost far more total time.

climax.text: The manager documented her Monday process. Her team member now owns it completely.

punchline.text: Repetition is the signal to delegate.

quiz.question: Why are recurring tasks ideal for delegation?
options: They're easy to standardize and cost predictable time
